com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Button

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Component
        |
        +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Button
All Implemented Interfaces:
Interactable
public final class Button
extends Component
implements Interactable

This class defines buttons. This class defines buttons. The Button class is one of the UI components to be used in high-level APIs, and it defines push buttons displaying character strings. The label character string is displayed in the center. 

  +---------------+
  |     ABCDE     |
  +---------------+
When the size is not designated, the component size is set to the minimum size which can contain the specified label character string. However, if the width is longer than the screen width, the width becomes the same as the screen width.
The behavior when the label character string cannot fit into this size is implementation dependent.

Constructor Summary
Button()
          This generates a button whose label character string is empty (" ").
Button(java.lang.String label)
          This generates a button with a designated label character string.

Constructor Detail

Button

public Button()
This generates a button whose label character string is empty (" "). When it generated, it is displayable and user-operable. To set either displayable or non-displayable, setVisible method is used. To set either user-operable or user-inoperable, setEnabled method is used.

Button

public Button(java.lang.String label)
This generates a button with a designated label character string. When it generated, it is displayable and user-operable. To set either displayable or non-displayable, setVisible method is used. To set either user-operable or user-inoperable, setEnabled method is used.

Parameters:
label - Designates a label character string. When null is designated, the empty character string (" ") is set.
Method Detail

setLabel

public void setLabel(java.lang.String label)
This sets a label character string for the button.

requestFocus

public void requestFocus()
This requests that the focus is to be set for the button. The request before adding a button to a panel via the add method is ignored.

Specified by:
requestFocus in interface Interactable

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean flag)
This sets the button user-operable or user-inoperable. User-operable is chosen in the default status.

Specified by:
setEnabled in interface Interactable
Parameters:
flag - Designates true to set user-operable and designates false to set user-inoperable.
